entries.text: DHL's official customer service pages provide support routing across shipment, tracking, and account issues.
DHL public support pages advertise multiple contact channels, including chat and messaging paths, which can still leave customers deciding which path to use first.
DHL provides a separate official tracking page for shipment status and delivery updates.
Delivery issues and shipment claims are often handled through specialized support and contact paths rather than a unified conversational support thread.
Public parcel-sector research continues to show high issue rates and contact-handling friction, underscoring the value of a guided resolution experience.

current_strengths: Strong tracking capabilities and multi-channel contact options
Official customer service pages for shipment support
Global support surface with self-service tooling
current_gaps_observed_or_likely: Tracking, contact, claims, and messaging paths are still separate customer journeys
No public evidence of one support thread preserving context across channels
No public customer-visible request tracker spanning delivery and claims issues
No public conversational resolution layer coordinating shipment support end-to-end
